ygData.subject: RE: Basic questions
ygData.msgSnippet: A monk s attacks have a base speed of 30. They are considered the ultimate melee class because of the damage potential of their special attacks and their
ygData.messageBody:
A monk's attacks have a base speed of 30. They are considered the ultimate
melee class because of the damage potential of their special attacks and
their higher skill caps on combat abilities.

I believe the base speed of our animation is a 30. Giving it a store-bought
dagger lowers that to 20, but doesn't lower the damage. Are you really
questioning the wisdom in doing that? Do you ever cast the Quickness line of
spells on your party's tanks? This is, in effect, a free permanent quickness
for your pet that stacks with your Quickness spell.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: jcent@... [SMTP:jcent@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 1999 8:45 AM
> To: Farr, Robert
> Cc: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Basic questions
>
> From: jcent@...
>
>
> if it doesn't change the amount of damage, then whats the point??
>
> wouldnt punching/bashing/kicking be the fastest possible? monks are our
> fastest melee class for that reason, aren't they? so giving it a weapon
> would only slow it down....right?
>
>
>
>
>
>
> From: "Farr, Robert" <Robert.Farr@...> on 10/06/99 06:41 AM PDT
>
> To: Jason Cent/Corp/OneInacom@Vanstar
> cc:
> Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Basic questions
>
> Yes, you can, but since our animations follow critter rules, you can't
> change the amount of damage it's capable of, only the speed of its attack.
> Therefore, find the fastest weapon you can (and don't mind losing) and
> give
> it to your animation. You can sharpen a few rusty daggers and carry em
> around with you if you aren't to the point where you can spend 2p on the
> faster store-bought daggers.
>
> I wonder what it would look like if you gave the animation a thulian claw?
> Any reeeaallly high level readers out there wanna try that one?
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Jason Cent [SMTP:jcent@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 1999 8:37 AM
> > To: Farr, Robert
> > Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Basic questions
> >
> > I'm confused...are you saying you can give your animation a weapon
> > to use????
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > From: "Farr, Robert" <Robert.Farr@...> on 10/06/99 06:31 AM
> > PDT
> > To: eqenchanters@onelist.com@SMTP@Exchange
> > cc:
> > Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Basic questions
> >
> > From: "Farr, Robert" <Robert.Farr@...>
> >
> > I've found lately that the only buff I need for my animation is a
> > good fast
> > dagger. At level 25, I normally travel with a lvl 30 druid friend
> > who heals
> > the pet in combat so I seldom lose one. Given that fact, I buy the
> > daggers
> > from the vendors. You know, the ones that cost 2p and have a delay
> > of 20.
> > Talk about supercharging your animation! Can't wait til level 29
> > when I can
> > give it 2 daggers!
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: mstokes [SMTP:mstokes@...]
> > > Sent: Wednesday, October 06, 1999 8:14 AM
> > > To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Basic questions
> > >
> > > From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
> > >
> > > Papa Legba wrote:
> > >
> > > > From: Papa Legba <legba@...>
> > > >
> > > > Do our buffs work on our animations? IE can I strengthen that
> > cute
> > > > little 4th lvl sword I just learned how to summon?
> > >
> > > Buff away, I wouldn't think of traveling with my enchantment
> > unless he
> > > was
> > > fully buffed (At your level I believe Haze and Strengthen are the
> > only 2
> > > buffs)
